intro: Stachystemon vinosus, commonly known as the purple-stemmed stachystemon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems that often display a distinctive purplish hue. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
